case_title: M. MUNAF SHAIKH vs QURESH ALI, ADVOCATE

accussed_details.name: Quresh Ali Sheikh
allegation: Violation of bond of service with Education Department

complaint_summary: The complainant alleged that the respondent suppressed material facts, submitted false affidavits, misrepresented his employment status while applying for enrolment as an advocate, and violated the bond of service with the Education Department. He was simultaneously employed as a Primary School Teacher and conducting pupilage, violating professional ethics and rules.
investigation_summary: The Sindh Bar Council Disciplinary Committee conducted inquiries and found the allegations substantiated. The respondent admitted to filing false affidavits and suppressing facts. The matter was referred to the Tribunal for further action.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found the respondent guilty of professional misconduct and perjury. It ordered his immediate removal from practice under section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1973. Criminal proceedings under section 191, P.P.C. were refrained due to the respondent's apology.
punishment: Immediate removal from practice under section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1973.
Decision_or_verdict: Guilty of professional misconduct and perjury; removal from practice.
legal_arguments: Violation of section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
Submission of false affidavits and suppression of material facts.
Professional misconduct as per Cannons of Conducts and Ethics prescribed for Advocates.
statutes: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973
sections: Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

witness_statement.Muhammad Munaf Shaikh: Filed a complaint alleging professional misconduct and perjury by the respondent.
witness_statement.Quresh Ali Sheikh: Admitted to filing false affidavits and termed the actions as a 'lapse'.

tribunal_findings.disciplinary_action: Immediate removal from practice under section 41 of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1973
tribunal_findings.criminal_prosecution: Not pursued due to respondent's apology

legal_terms.Perjury: The offense of willfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Violation of professional ethics or rules governing the conduct of advocates.

words_and_phrases.Lapse: A minor or temporary failure; used by the respondent to describe his actions.
words_and_phrases.Cannons of Conducts and Ethics: Rules governing the professional behavior of advocates.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves allegations of professional misconduct and perjury against Quresh Ali Sheikh, who simultaneously worked as a Primary School Teacher and pursued pupilage.
